channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-27669] Hive Acid CTAS fails incremental if no of rows inserted is > INT_MAX
item.description:
• If a Table is created using CTAS with rows > INT_MAX then beeline eats up the thrown error
  •  As replication also uses the same infra it should also do the same instead of failing with NumberFormatException

Note:  This is happening in the customer's environment consistently but we are not able to reproduce it. So, we have gone through the whole code flow and handled the error accordingly.

 

Error message while incremental replication:

4:12:03.230 PM	INFO	Driver	[Scheduled Query Executor(schedule:repl_sample_acid_1, execution_id:49625)]: Starting task [Stage-10066:REPL_STATE_LOG] in serial mode4:12:03.231 item.summary: Hive Acid CTAS fails incremental if no of rows inserted is > INT_MAX

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
